column5: Took the wife and son to Glen Haffy Conservation for some fishing at the stocked ponds. After paying 18 dollars for 2 adult day pass and fishing passes we had to almost fight our way to the water at the lower pond. But after about 45 min. there were only about a dozen of us left. Used spinners with no luck. Then worm and bobber with no luck. But then we went to little wite and green powerbaits with bobber and the tiny sinkers and they just kept hitting like crazy. Cought about 12 - 15 in 2 hours between me and the wife. Nothing real big but we kept three for dinner tonight. Saw a lot being caught on flyrod too. And a few nice ones.
nice outing... it's always great to see guys getting their family involved I have never been there before but wouldn't mind finding the place...
Being two feet tall, how did you get those fish in the sink???
Airport road north of 124 (Charleston Sdrd.) or south of Hwy 9 aka 109. On the east side of the road.  http://www.thehillsofheadwaters.com/glenha...mem-welcome.php
Great pics. I love how the little guy is seasoning the trout on the gravel road
Cute pics of your little guy.

Nice report!  jsut wonder what the rules are regarding fish caught.  Are there number of the fish you are allowed to keep?  If so, are you allowed to throw back the ones you dont want to keep and keep fishing?  Thanks
Priceless pics who needs fish crisp when you can parkinglot gravel

There is a limit of 2 per paying customer. You have to show your fishing reciept to the park guys if they ask. I saw a few people who only kept one and kept releasing the others till they were ready to go and they would keep the last one. If you have 2 keepers in your posession you have to stop fishing.
....Great pictures, put a big smile on my face.
